let me introduce to You
REO this little fell was developed by a

the autonomous systems laboratory at e

instead of Wheels a ball B is balancing
and moving on one single ball the main
characteristics of such a system is that
there's one sole contact point to the
ground this means that the robot is
inherently unstable it's like when I'm
trying to stand on one
foot you might ask yourself what's the
usefulness of a robot that's unstable
and I will explain that in a second let
me first explain how rero actually keeps
his balance rero keeps his balance by
constantly measuring his pitch angle
with a
sensor he then counteracts and avoids
toppling over by turning the motors
appropriately this happens 160 times per
second and if anything fa during this
process rero would immediately fall to
the ground now to move and to balance
rero needs to turn the ball the ball is
driven by three special wheels that
allow rero to move into any direction
and also move around his own axis at the
same
time due to his instability RoR is
always in motion now here's the trick
it's indeed exactly this instability
that allows a robot to move very
